delay_drivers: Admission-to-OR time >18 hours without clinical justification
After-hours surgery for routine supracondylar fracture without safety need
Multiple interfacility transfers before definitive fixation
Repeat imaging cycles causing delay before OR start
OR start delayed due to team/room availability without documented rationale
bundle_compliance: Pre-op antibiotics not administered within recommended window before incision
Missing antibiotic re-dosing for long spine cases (>4 hours)
Missing CHG wash or MRSA screening documentation for spine fusion cases
No documentation of vancomycin powder or betadine irrigation in high-risk spine cases
Post-op antibiotics continued >24 hours without evidence of infection
outcome_risks: Ischemic hand progression after supracondylar fracture
Iatrogenic nerve palsy after pinning of supracondylar fracture
Loss of reduction in cast or spica requiring reoperation
Limb length discrepancy >2 cm after femoral shaft fracture treatment
Deep surgical site infection after spine or long-bone fixation
Malunion or angular deformity after displaced forearm fracture
readmission_risks: High-risk neuromuscular scoliosis with poor nutrition or pulmonary reserve
Post–spine fusion readmissions for pneumonia, ileus, UTI, or SSI
Early return after fracture surgery for pain, loss of reduction, or hardware failure
infection_risks: Long fusion construct with prolonged operative time
Neuromuscular scoliosis with poor soft tissue coverage or incontinence
Reoperation through prior incision or scar tissue
Early dressing disruption or persistent wound drainage after surgery
volume_signals: Annual volume of index fracture procedures (SCH, femoral shaft, displaced forearm)
Annual spine fusion volume per surgeon for AIS and NMS
Proportion of complex or high-risk deformity cases in total volume
documentation_gaps: Missing pre-operative neurovascular exam for limb fractures
Missing post-reduction perfusion status documentation (e.g., pink/warm vs white/cool hand)
No clear documentation of planned vs unplanned return to OR
ICD-10 codes missing specificity for fracture type, laterality, or open/closed status
safety_signals: Pain out of proportion to exam after casting or fixation
3 As pattern: anxiety, agitation, and escalating analgesia requirements
Pale or cool extremity after casting or surgery without timely escalation
Rapid response activation, ICU transfer, or emergent return to OR after limb surgery
